description: This course compares Christian and Islamic conceptions of the relationship between God and humanity, as foundations for thinking about moral excellence and obligation. It also considers and compares how theological commitments and methods in each religious tradition affect approaches to particular ethical issues such as sexuality, war, and politics. Students work with scripture, film, polemical literature, judicial texts, and theological texts. Prerequisites: BTS-T or permission of instructor.
name: Christ/Islamic Ethics
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BTS-T or permission of instructor.
title: Christian and Islamic Ethics: Conflicts and Cross-Pollination
